summary: enteroviruses are a large and diverse family of small (30-nm) nonenveloped viruses with a positive-sense RNA genome. human pathogens are found among the EV-A to EV-L species and the three rhinovirus species. the best-known pathogenic enterovirus is poliovirus (PV), the causative agent of poliomyelitis. 2Apro cleaves at the junction between the structural proteins (P1 region) and its own N terminus. both proteases also cleave host cell factors to optimize virus replication. a well-known antiviral response is the induction of type I interferons.
